page.title: 05Coniferous Woodland,Dorset.
page.content: About one quarter of our 12 km block is covered in coniferous woods. The trees are mainly Scots Pine, planted in straight rows cut across with fire-breaks.In some plantations the trees are only 2 metres high,in others the trees reach over 15 metres. Between the smaller trees,beside roads and covering the fire breaks,is an undergrowth of grasses,heather and bracken .Small self-seeded Silver Birches grow in bushy clusters. We walked for an hour along the B3081 from Eblake towards Ringwood, along the edge of the pine plantations listing the wild flowers.We found Rag- wort,Lesser Yellow Trefoil,Dandelion, Tormetil,Meadow Buttercup,Agrimony and Broom;Vetch,Sorrel and Willowherb;pink and white Yarrow,Stitchwort,Ox-eye Daisy,White Clover and Heath Bedstraw; Great Plantain and Ribwort Plantain.
